Description:
The Cyber Security 3rd partyRisk Analyst is a position, responsible to carry out cyber assessments and analysis of the information security risk environment of external suppliers.Working with key stakeholders such as Procurement, Security Architecture and Technology Change teams to ensure adequate controls are adhered to when onboarding new vendors.
Working with the 1LOD and 2LOD teams to develop and maintain risk profiles for key LSEG third partiesKey Responsibilities:Responsible for conducting timely security assessments of third-party suppliers, recording results accurately and initiating appropriate assurance responses
Support the production of high quality, informative and accurate reports in respect of third-party assurance assessments
Provide advice and guidance to stakeholders on Information/Cyber Security Minimum Requirements.
Participate in and contribute to collection of KRI’s, MI reporting on 3rd party cyber risks and assessments  
Assist in the improvement of risk management and Cyber Security controls
Ensure all activity is compliant with NIST, GDPR and other Financial Services relevant legislation including CPMI IOSCO.
Support the Third-Party Senior Manager with all third-party vendor risk assessment activities and reporting tasksTechnical/job knowledge:Understanding and working knowledge of control frameworks based on industry best practices such as NIST, COBIT, and ISO27001.
Understanding of key regulatory requirements for technology and cyber security in the main LSEG operating centres
Cyber security qualification e.g. CISSP / CISM (desirable)
Degree or Masters qualification in Cyber, Information Security or IT management (desirable)
IT and cybersecurity policies and standards
Operational risk frameworks
Third Party Risk Frameworks
Regulatory compliance
Technology resiliency
Data protectionExperience:Experienced professional with 3-5 years or more experience in Cyber Security Third Party Risk Management or Governance and Control Assessment, Risk and/orAt LSEG, we believe that creating a diverse and inclusive organisation is fundamental to the way we deliver on our promise of creating essential partnerships and open opportunities.
